description._content: Author: Unknown Subject: National Museum of Natural History (U.S.)        Natural History Building        United States National Museum Type: Photographic print     Exhibit Date: 1957 Topic: Hall of Colonial Culture      Exhibitions      Colonial Era, America      Massachusetts Bay Colony House Standard number: 44179-C and MAH-44179C Physical description: Color: Black and White; Size: 10w x 8h; Type of Image: Exhibit; Medium: Photographic print Notes: See Neg. #SIA2009-2194 for another view of the room and Neg. #SIA2009-2195 for a view of the outside of the house when it was in Massachusetts Summary: Interior view shows the fireplace, wooden chair and a fur rug of a 17th century Massachusetts Bay Colony House installed in 1957 in the United States National Museum, now known as the National Museum of Natural History, as a part of the Hall of Colonial Culture Place: Massachusetts Persistent URL:Link to data base record Repository:Smithsonian Archives - History Div View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
